aslsd.events.process_path module

class aslsd.events.process_path.ProcessPath(list_times, T_f, d=None, n_events=None, eta=None, list_times2end=None, kappa=None, varpi=None, lag_sizes=None)

Bases: object

aslsd.events.time_ordering module

aslsd.events.time_ordering.get_kappa_varpi(list_times, T_f)

Compute the functions \(\kappa\) and \(\varpi\), needed for chronological ordering of event times across dimensions, and return them as arrays.

  • \(\kappa(j,i,m)\) is the index of the latest event of type \(j\)

preceding event time \(t_m^i\).

  • \(\varpi(i,j,h)\) is the smallest index \(m\) such that there

exists at least h events of type \(j\) preceding event time \(t_m^i\).

Parameters

  • list_times (list of np.ndarray) – list_times[i] is the sorted array of events of type \(i\).

  • T_f (float) – Terminal time.

Returns

  • kappa (list of list of numpy.ndarray) – Description.

  • varpi (list of list of numpy.ndarray) – Description.

Raises

IndexError – If T_f is smaller than list_times[i][-1] for some i.

aslsd.events.time_ordering.get_lag_sizes(list_times, kappa, varpi)

Compute the number of event of type \(i\) with at least \(h\) predecessors of type \(j\), for all \(i,j \in [d]\), \(h \in [\kappa(j,i,N^i_T)]\).

Parameters

  • list_times (list of np.ndarray) – list_times[i] is the sorted array of events of type \(i\).

  • kappa (list of list of numpy.ndarray) – DESCRIPTION.

  • varpi (list of list of numpy.ndarray) – DESCRIPTION.

Returns

lag_sizes – lag_sizes[i][j][h] is the number of events of type \(i\) with at least \(h\) predecessors of type \(j\). By convention, matrix_lag_sizes[i][j][0]=0.

Return type

list of list of np.ndarray
